messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Reincarnation and being chosen, was Re: christians again
messages.msgSnippet: Yes. It s really amazing to hear what these children say!! As Brianna says, I can say anything to you!! That s what we have. Trust. Love. Honesty.
messages.messageBody:
Yes. It's really amazing to hear what these children say!! As Brianna says, "I can say anything to you!!" That's what we have. Trust. Love. Honesty. Acceptance.
I think it takes that for the kids to be able to verbalize these concepts.

Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Robin Clevenger
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, April 12, 2003 1:03 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Reincarnation and being chosen, was Re: christians again


From: "coyote's corner" <jana@...>
<<<I've always felt that Brianna was meant for me to raise. I've told her
that her bio-mom had to have her because I couldn't. Have you read anything
about reincarnation? If you'd like, we can talk of this off list. Although,
reincarnation has much to do w/ my decision to unschool!!>>>>

I hadn't given it much thought - being "chosen" by my kids, but one day when
Mackenzie was 2, he said to me "Remember that time when you were dressed
like a white princess and you walked down a long trail with lots of people
beside it and dad was standing on the other end, and I was floating on the
ceiling and watching you?" All I can figure from that conversation was that
he was present at our wedding, *years* before he was conceived. Asa has said
some very similar stuff when she was a young toddler, she mentioned our
wedding once too. I do believe now that they chose us.

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
